meta.description:
Imagine a futuristic transportation network connecting 9 major hubs across a sprawling metropolis, each designed to swiftly move resources from the main distribution center to a critical operations base. This network is meticulously engineered with roads of varying capacities, ensuring the smooth flow of essential supplies.

The city's network is as follows, with each road's capacity measured in thousands of units of resources that can be transported per hour:

- From Hub 0 (Source): Roads lead to Hub 1 (4 units), Hub 2 (7 units), Hub 3 (15 units), Hub 4 (4 units), Hub 5 (7 units), Hub 6 (2 units), Hub 7 (10 units), and Hub 8 (12 units).
- From Hub 1: Roads lead to Hub 2 (17 units), Hub 3 (2 units), Hub 4 (5 units), Hub 5 (1 unit), Hub 6 (10 units), Hub 7 (14 units), and Hub 8 (5 units).
- From Hub 2: Roads lead to Hub 1 (7 units), Hub 3 (17 units), Hub 4 (9 units), Hub 5 (13 units), Hub 6 (10 units), Hub 7 (7 units), and Hub 8 (5 units).
- From Hub 3: Roads lead to Hub 1 (16 units), Hub 2 (4 units), Hub 4 (11 units), Hub 5 (9 units), Hub 6 (12 units), Hub 7 (18 units), and Hub 8 (12 units).
- From Hub 4: Roads lead to Hub 1 (3 units), Hub 2 (0 units), Hub 3 (18 units), Hub 5 (5 units), Hub 6 (2 units), and Hub 8 (19 units).
- From Hub 5: Roads lead to Hub 1 (15 units), Hub 2 (7 units), Hub 3 (20 units), Hub 4 (20 units), Hub 6 (20 units), Hub 7 (12 units), and Hub 8 (9 units).
- From Hub 6: Roads lead to Hub 1 (8 units), Hub 2 (14 units), Hub 3 (13 units), Hub 4 (1 unit), Hub 5 (17 units), Hub 7 (10 units), and Hub 8 (19 units).
- From Hub 7: Roads lead to Hub 1 (5 units), Hub 2 (5 units), Hub 3 (16 units), Hub 4 (5 units), Hub 5 (7 units), Hub 6 (3 units), and Hub 8 (19 units).
- From Hub 8 (Destination): Roads lead back to Hub 1 (19 units), Hub 2 (18 units), Hub 3 (0 units), Hub 4 (4 units), Hub 5 (7 units), Hub 6 (1 unit), and Hub 7 (20 units).

A capacity of "0" indicates that there is no direct road connecting those two hubs.

This complex system has been designed with an aim to maximize the resources transported from Hub 0, the primary distribution center, to Hub 8, the critical operations base, without exceeding the capacity of the roads connecting these hubs.

The challenge: What is the maximum amount of resources, in thousands of units, that can be transported from the primary distribution center (Hub 0) to the critical operations base (Hub 8) per hour?

params.name: capacity
params.description: Capacity of roads between hubs in thousands of units

vars.name: flow
vars.description: Flow of resources between hubs in thousands of units

objective.name: max_flow
objective.description: Maximize the flow from Hub 0 to Hub 8

constraints.name: capacity_0_1
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 1

constraints.name: capacity_0_2
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 2

constraints.name: capacity_0_3
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 3

constraints.name: capacity_0_4
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 4

constraints.name: capacity_0_5
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 5

constraints.name: capacity_0_6
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 6

constraints.name: capacity_0_7
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 7

constraints.name: capacity_0_8
constraints.description: Capacity constraint for road from Hub 0 to Hub 8

constraints.name: flow_conservation_1
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['1'] for j in H if j != '1') + quicksum(flow[i]['1'] for i in H if i != '1')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['1'][j] for j in H if j != '1')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_2
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['2'] for j in H if j != '2') + quicksum(flow[i]['2'] for i in H if i != '2')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['2'][j] for j in H if j != '2')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_3
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['3'] for j in H if j != '3') + quicksum(flow[i]['3'] for i in H if i != '3')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['3'][j] for j in H if j != '3')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_4
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['4'] for j in H if j != '4') + quicksum(flow[i]['4'] for i in H if i != '4')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['4'][j] for j in H if j != '4')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_5
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['5'] for j in H if j != '5') + quicksum(flow[i]['5'] for i in H if i != '5')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['5'][j] for j in H if j != '5')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_6
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['6'] for j in H if j != '6') + quicksum(flow[i]['6'] for i in H if i != '6')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['6'][j] for j in H if j != '6')

constraints.name: flow_conservation_7
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(flow['0']['7'] for j in H if j != '7') + quicksum(flow[i]['7'] for i in H if i != '7')
constraints.expr_rhs: quicksum(flow['7'][j] for j in H if j != '7')
